656064080423668.title: Mechanicals Program Manager
656064080423668.location: Sunnyvale, CA • Seattle, WA • Full Time
656064080423668.responsibilities: Drive day-to-day tooling, molding and secondary operation activities to meet the overall program objectives with a heavy focus on plastic/metal tooling release, tooling trial schedule oversight, post molding CNC and coating operations including assembly and testing Create and maintain program schedules, track program progress, risk identification and mitigation, prioritization of work tasks for the Mechanical Operations team Assist in directing internal and external resources to execute programs successfully Collaborate with engineering, operations, and our supply base partners to meet schedule, quality and volume targets Work with cross functional partner teams to drive engineering build and mass-production readiness for Mechanical Components Help to drive Failure Analysis Corrective Action and yield improvements International travel up to 20%
656064080423668.minimum_qualifications: Minimum of 8 years of experience in manufacturing of mechanical components in the Plastics Molding and Tooling industry Minimum of 5 years of project management experience Experience in launching high cosmetic, consumer electronics products Experience working with a global supply chain and a background in project coordination with Asia-based manufacturers, remotely and onsite Working knowledge of GD&T, data analysis and statistics Proven bottom line project management experience (Planning, Cost, & Delivery) Demonstrated experience to operate in ambiguous, deadline focused environment with minimal supervision
656064080423668.preferred_qualifications: Experience with root cause analysis of plastic and metal part defects Data analysis using JMP PMP Certification Proven experience with insert molding, 2 shot molding, MIM, stamping and die-casting Working knowledge of plastic resins, metal removal processes and post molding operations, coatings, sub-assembly and testing

803681775701053.title: Research Scientist Intern, Multimodal Eye Tracking Algorithms (PhD)
803681775701053.responsibilities: Participate in cutting-edge Computer Vision & Machine Learning research and development for VR/AR/MR related topics Collaborate with and support other researchers across various disciplines. Design and implement robust algorithms for multimodal eye-tracking systems Communicate research agenda, progress and results Publish research results in top-tier journals and at leading international conferences Document and present research progress and aim to publish findings at high-impact CV/ML conferences
803681775701053.minimum_qualifications: Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a PhD in Computer Science, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, or related field Knowledge in CV/ML, in one or more of the following domains: 3D computer vision, object detection and tracking, image/volume processing, optimization, calibration, 3D tracking, 3D pose estimation 2+ years of experience with Machine Learning for solving computer vision and/or computer graphics problems Experience with deep learning frameworks such as Pytorch and TensorBoard Experience with scientific programming languages such as Python Excellent interpersonal skills, cross-group and cross-culture collaboration Ability to communicate complex research in a clear, precise, and actionable manner Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment
803681775701053.preferred_qualifications: Proven track record of achieving significant results as demonstrated by publications in top CV/ML conferences (e.g., CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, ICML etc.) or journals Demonstrated software engineering experience via an internship, work experience, coding competitions, or widely used contributions in open source repositories (e.g. GitHub) Experience working on high volume image data processing or synthesis Experience with one or more of the following: simultaneous localization and mapping (SLAM), sensor fusion, volumetric imaging Hands-on experience working with research grade lab prototypes to set up experiments, collect, and analyze data to validate hypotheses Broad, end-to-end understanding of all aspects of tracking objects in 3D space (i.e. hardware, firmware, software, algorithm, analysis, evaluation) Experience with basic optical systems, with an emphasis on the optics of the human eye Intent to return to a degree-program after the completion of the internship
